p: A lot of applications have been proposed for guayule resin. The whole resin can be used as a wood preservative, against damage by Teredinidae, and Limnoria sp. and particularly, against the very destructive Coptotermes termite species [ 107, 108]. Resin shows a prooxidant activity, and it is especially interesting because prooxidants (or peptizers) are ordinarily toxic synthetic products [ 53]. It can also be used in the formulation of coatings and paints, bringing good properties (abrasion resistance, gloss, drying time, and water resistance) [ 11, 53].
